title: Implement mail folder operations (move, delete, mark)
description:
Implement folder management commands.

Commands:
  h8 mail mv <id> <folder>  # move message to folder
  h8 mail rm <id>           # move to trash
  h8 mail rm <id> --force   # permanently delete
  h8 mail mark <id> --read  # mark as read
  h8 mail mark <id> --unread # mark as unread

All operations:
1. Update local Maildir (move file, rename for flags)
2. Queue change for sync to Exchange
3. Next sync pushes changes to server

Folder names: inbox, sent, drafts, trash, junk, or custom folder names.

title: Implement compose format parser (YAML frontmatter + body)
description:
Create parser/serializer for the email compose format.

Format:
---
to: alice@example.com, bob@example.com
cc: carol@example.com
subject: Re: Meeting tomorrow
in-reply-to: <original-message-id>
references: <thread-root-id> <original-message-id>
---

Hi Alice,

Thanks for the update...

> Original quoted text here

Features:
- Parse frontmatter headers (to, cc, bcc, subject, in-reply-to, references)
- Extract body text
- Generate compose files from existing messages (for reply/forward)
- Handle signature injection
- Support quote_style configuration (default: '> ')

title: Implement SQLite sync database
description:
Create SQLite database for tracking sync state between local and Exchange.

Schema:
CREATE TABLE messages (
    local_id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,      -- maildir filename
    remote_id TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL, -- EWS item ID
    change_key TEXT,                -- EWS change key
    folder TEXT NOT NULL,
    subject TEXT,
    from_addr TEXT,
    received_at DATETIME,
    is_read BOOLEAN,
    is_draft BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    synced_at DATETIME,
    local_hash TEXT                 -- detect local edits
);

CREATE TABLE sync_state (
    folder TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    last_sync DATETIME,
    sync_token TEXT                 -- for incremental sync
);

Location: $XDG_DATA_HOME/h8/mail/<account>/.sync.db

title: Implement human-readable email ID system
description:
Implement the adjective-noun ID system for emails.

Format: <adjective>-<noun> (e.g., 'cold-lamp', 'blue-frog')

Components:
- Load word lists from h8/data/word_lists.toml (already generated)
- SQLite table for ID pool management
- Random selection from free pool
- Mark IDs as used when assigned, free when email deleted
- Avoid same-word combinations (e.g., 'cold-cold')

Schema:
CREATE TABLE id_pool (
    short_id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    status TEXT DEFAULT 'free',  -- 'free' | 'used'
    assigned_at DATETIME,
    message_remote_id TEXT
);

~441k effective combinations with recycling.

title: getting information currently takes a long time, at least 10 seconds. We need to figure out why and how we could speed this up
Implement mail compose/reply/forward with editor integration
description:
Implement compose workflow with $EDITOR (neovim) integration.

Commands:
  h8 mail compose           # new message
  h8 mail reply <id>        # reply to message
  h8 mail reply <id> --all  # reply-all
  h8 mail forward <id>      # forward message

Workflow:
1. Generate compose file with pre-filled headers
2. For reply: add quoted original, set in-reply-to/references
3. For forward: include original as quoted text
4. Add signature if configured
5. Write to temp file
6. Open $EDITOR and wait for exit
7. Parse saved file
8. Save as draft to local Maildir
9. Sync draft to Exchange
10. Print draft ID for later send

Config options:
[mail.compose]
format = 'text'
quote_style = '> '
include_signature = true

title: Implement local Maildir storage
description:
Implement local email storage using Maildir format.

Directory structure:
$XDG_DATA_HOME/h8/mail/<account>/
  inbox/
    cur/    # read messages
    new/    # unread messages
    tmp/    # temp during write
  sent/
  drafts/
  trash/
  .sync.db  # SQLite sync state

Features:
- Create/read/update/delete messages in Maildir
- Handle read/unread flags via filename conventions
- Support for draft messages
- Atomic writes via tmp directory

title: Implement mail sync command
description:
Implement bidirectional sync between local Maildir and Exchange.

Commands:
  h8 mail sync              # sync all configured folders
  h8 mail sync inbox        # sync specific folder
  h8 mail sync --full       # full re-sync (ignore sync tokens)

Sync logic:
1. Fetch remote changes since last sync (using sync tokens if available)
2. Download new/changed messages to local Maildir
3. Detect local changes (new drafts, read/unread flags, deletions)
4. Push local changes to Exchange
5. Update sync state in SQLite

Handle conflicts:
- Remote wins for most fields
- Local draft edits preserved until explicitly synced

title: Implement vim-style navigation and key handling

Quick actions:

- r: Refresh
- /: Search
- s: Sort menu

title: Implement draft management and send commands
description:
Implement draft listing, editing, and sending.

Commands:
  h8 mail drafts            # list all drafts
  h8 mail edit <draft-id>   # edit existing draft in $EDITOR
  h8 mail send <draft-id>   # send specific draft
  h8 mail send --all        # send all drafts

Send workflow:
1. Load draft from local Maildir
2. Parse headers and body
3. Call Python service to send via EWS
4. On success:
   - Delete from local drafts folder
   - Delete from remote drafts (EWS)
   - Message appears in Sent (EWS handles this)
5. Sync sent folder to get local copy

Draft listing shows:
- Draft ID (e.g., 'cold-lamp')
- Subject
- Recipients
- Last modified time

title: Add draft save/sync endpoints to Python service
description:
Extend the Python EWS service to support draft operations.

New endpoints needed:
POST /mail/draft          # save draft to Exchange drafts folder
PUT  /mail/draft/<id>     # update existing draft
DELETE /mail/draft/<id>   # delete draft

Draft operations in mail.py:
- save_draft(account, message_data) -> dict with id, changekey
- update_draft(account, item_id, message_data) -> dict
- delete_draft(account, item_id) -> dict

Drafts are saved to account.drafts folder in Exchange.
